raw_text: Of the several slightly different definitions of a base NP in the literature we use for the purposes of this work the definition presented in (Ramshaw and Marcus, 1995) and used also by (Argamon et al, 1998) and others
clean_text: Of the several slightly different definitions of a base NP in the literature we use for the purposes of this work the definition presented in (Ramshaw and Marcus, 1995) and used also by (Argamon et al, 1998) and others.

raw_text: SV phrases, following the definition suggested in (Argamon et al, 1998), are word phrases starting with the subject of the sentence and ending with the first verb, excluding modal verbs 2
clean_text: SV phrases, following the definition suggested in (Argamon et al, 1998), are word phrases starting with the subject of the sentence and ending with the first verb, excluding modal verbs.

raw_text: As reported in (Argamon et al, 1998), most base NPs present in ~he data are less or equal than 4 words long

citing_paper_authors: Minlie, Huang | Borui, Ye | Yichen, Wang | Haiqiang, Chen | Junjun, Cheng | Xiaoyan, Zhu
raw_text: Argamon et al (1998) segmented the POS sequence of a multi-word into small POS tiles, counted tile frequency in the new word and non-new-word on the training set respectively, and detected new words using these counts
clean_text: Argamon et al (1998) segmented the POS sequence of a multi-word into small POS tiles, counted tile frequency in the new word and non-new-word on the training set respectively, and detected new words using these counts.

raw_text: (Argamon et al, 1998) use Memory-Based Sequence Learning for recognizing both NP chunks and VP chunks
clean_text: (Argamon et al, 1998) use Memory-Based Sequence Learning for recognizing both NP chunks and VP chunks.
